description.p: While most warlocks approach their patrons searching for unlimited power and fame, Warlocks of the Ever Dreamer are selected, for one reason or another, by a powerful entity to be their vessel on the material plane. In exchange, the ever dreamer offers a portion of its power to the Warlock.

description.p: The Ever Dreamer lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

sheet.description: The Ever Dreamer lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell.

description.p: Starting at 1st level, your patron teaches you about dreams, and how they can effect living creatures, even while they're awake. When a creature hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to force them to make a constitution saving throw. On a failure they suffer a point of exhaustion for the next minute. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your charisma modifier per long rest. Creatures that are immune to exhaustion are immune to this effect.

description.p: At 6th level, your patron allows you to temporarily occupy the minds of others. As a bonus action you can enter the mind of one willing creature within 60ft of you. While within the creatures mind, you have total cover, are immune to all damage except for psychic and are incapacitated. The only creature that can hear you is the creature whose mind you are in. At the start of the creatures next turn, or if they fall unconscious, you are ejected 10ft away from the creature. You can use this feature once per short rest.

description.p: At 10th level your patron teaches you ways you can use your mind to defend yourself. You cannot be put to sleep against your will and attacks against you while you are unconscious are not auto-crits, additionally you are immune to psychic damage.

description.p: At 14th level, you can plunge a creature into a darkened slumber, filled with nightmares that attack them. As an action, choose a creature that you can see within 60ft of you. It must make a wisdom save. On a failed save it takes 8d8 psychic damage and is knocked unconscious for 1 minute or until it takes damage. On a successful save the creature takes half damage and is not knocked unconscious. Undead and constructs automatically succeed. You can do this once per long rest.
